Name: Inner coffin of Hetep-Amun
Description: The wooden coffin was covered with cartonnage and painted. The chest is covered with an ornate collar and a bead net with the sky goddess, Nut. Underneath are registers with gods. The wig is decorated with a fillet. On the underside of the coffin is a painted picture of a djed-pillar flanked by two standards of the west. The inside of the coffin was painted white. This inner coffin is associated with an outer coffin, which is also kept in the Vienna Museum (Ã„OS 220).
